http.title: Land Registration - | D F P (N I) - Landweb Direct
http.html:
• Home
  • Direct Access Link
  • Latest News
  • Downloads
  • Land & Property Services
  • About

As a user of landweb direct you will have instant on-line access to the Land Registry, Registry of Deeds and Statutory Charges. This new direct access service allows customers to obtain information for conveyancing and property information purposes in a simple, quick and inexpensive way

The aim of registering title to land is to create and maintain a register of landowners whose title is guaranteed by the state - basically making the transfer and mortgaging of land easier.

Important Notices

Maintenance Outage

Please note that due to essential maintenance both Landweb Direct and eRegistration websites will be unavailable on Tuesday 5th and Thursday 7th March between the hours of 6:30pm and 11pm


Land Web Direct Revised Terms and Conditions – Updated 9th October 2017

Various ameents have been made to advisory text to assist users for instance -

  • Document Requests
  • Search screens to highlight guidance on use of wildcards


Protect the priority of your cases...

Every year around 18% of land registration applications are rejected and returned to the applicant. 81% of rejected applications are unsuccessful because of a number of basic errors. LPS has developed a simple checklist to help you get applications right first time to protect the priority of your cases: 

  • Enclose all required documents

·   Enclose the correct fee

·   Date the form and/or cheque

·   Sign the form and/or cheque

 

By getting your application right first time, you can protect the priority of your case. With fewer case rejections, LPS can focus on dealing with correctly completed applications quicker.

Browser Security Changes

Transport Layer Security (TLS) is the technology used to encrypt information flowing between a user’s browser and the LWD/E-REG websites. An early version of technology (TLS 1.0) is being retired from use. Users will need to ensure their browser supports the later 1.1 or 1.2 versions of the technology to continue to use the websites from 1st July 2016.

The following versions of Internet Explorer may be used to access LWD/E-REG after the above date.

  • IE 11 on Windows 7, 8.1 and 10. Users need not take any further action unless TLS 1.1 and 1.2 have been specifically disabled by their IT department
  • IE 10 on Windows 7 and 8. Users must enable TLS 1.1 and 1.2 as per the instructions below
  • IE 8 and 9 on Windows 7. Users must enable TLS 1.1 and 1.2 as per the instructions below

All other combinations of Internet Explorer and Windows will NOT be able to access the websites from 1st July 2016.

Steps to enable TLS 1.1 and 1.2 in Internet Explorer (if required). These changes can be made in advance of 1st July 2016.

  1. On the Internet Explorer main menu, select Tools > Internet Options
  2. In the Internet Options box, select the Advanced tab
  3. In the Security category, tick the Use TLS 1.1 and Use TLS 1.2 options
  4. Click OK
  5. Exit and restart Internet Explorer


Automated Emails

As of the 4th April 2016 all automated emails from Landweb Direct will come from the email address customer.information@landwebni.gov.uk. Please do not send emails to this address as it is not monitored.

Land Registry Email Scam

Please be aware scam emails with attachments are currently circulating purporting to have been sent by Land Registry. In the event of receiving one of these emails please do not open the attachment and delete the email immediately.

Windows 10 and Microsoft Edge Browser

The Landweb Direct service is currently only fully tested and compatible with the Internet Explorer browser. If you are migrating to Windows 10 your default browser may be the new Microsoft Edge Browser. This browser may not provide the full functionality required for this service. For Windows 10 users, we would recommend that you select the option to change to Internet Explorer 11 when entering Landweb Direct. This option can be found in the settings menu of the Edge browser.
Latest News

Land Registers Notice to customers. Registry of Deeds pre-1990 records

Registry of Deeds’ Pre-1990 records have been recently housed in the Public Record Office of Northern Ireland (PRONI). These records are now being relocated from PRONI to Land & Property Services (LPS), Customer Information Centre (CIC) at Lanyon Plaza, 7 Lanyon Place, Belfast, BT1 3LP.

There will be a downtime of service to accommodate this move with the PRONI service closing on Thursday 21st March 2019 at 4.00 pm. Commencement of service in LPS is Wednesday 27th March 2019 at 9.30 am.

The hours of opening in LPS CIC are:

• Monday to Thursday 9.30 am to 4.30 pm; and
• Friday 10.00 am to 4.30 pm


TO ALL LANDWEB DIRECT USERS

From Monday 19th November 2018 there will be a number of enhancements available on LandWeb Direct. Users are advised of the following :-

  • Upon the E-generation of a Form 100, functionality has been enhanced so that a lodging firm’s signature and the date the form is signed will auto-populate on completion of the document.  The applicant may still sign the hard copy form if they wish but this will not be required by the Land Registry.
  • Acknowledgements for the lodgement of applications will be available either electronically or by paper, but not both.  Where the user’s preference is currently for the receipt of both, acknowledgement correspondence will now be available to view or download within the case folder in the user’s E-Reg account.  A daily email will issue to the user notifying them that the correspondence is available and a paper acknowledgement will no longer issue.
  • Correspondence from Land Registry raising enquiries with the applicant (SE Letters) and confirming completion of the application (DN Letters) will continue to be sent by post, but will also be uploaded to the case folder in the user’s E-Reg account.  A daily email will issue to the user notifying them that the correspondence is available.
  • Users who wish to change their setting preferences may contact the LandWeb Direct team on 0300 200 7803.

Practitioners should ensure that a current and valid email address is associated with each user account.

Users should note that for e-registration applications, the option to request acknowledgements and enquiry/closing correspondence by post, where no documents are to be returned, will be phased out in due course.  The date of discontinuation will be advised at the appropriate time.

For guidance notes click here


(TH)
Services

The direct access service will provide access to Land Registers of Northern Ireland electronic information (maps and folios) and documentation. The following features summarise the services available through landweb direct:



  • direct access to Land Registry
  • direct access to maps
  • direct access to Registry of Deeds
  • direct access to Statutory Charges searches
  • increased speed and level of search facilities
  • an integrated Mapbase, accessible via property or map criteria
  • access to maps from folios and vice versa
  • on-line payment facilities
  • case status tracking of Land Registry applications
  • facility to request un/certified copies
How to Register

Any customers who wish to register for the direct access service will need to contact Land Registers to receive the Registration Pack on 030 0200 7803 or call in at the public counter.

Please note that at all times, customers including members of the public will continue to be able to use landweb direct for personal searching at the LPS Public Counters

Secure Payments

LPS Contact Information

  • Registration Directorate
  • Lanyon Plaza
  • 7 Lanyon Place
  • Town Parks
  • Belfast
  • BT1 3LP

LPS Related Links

  • Direct
  • NI Business Info
  • Landweb Direct
  • Maps
  • GeoHub NI

NI Direct brings together lots of information from government departments and agencies, written in a language that is easy to understand. You don't need to know the workings of government to find what you are after.
